Class Kiva

  • java.lang.Object
    • Kiva

  • public class Kiva
extends java.lang.Object
    Kiva objects can perform actions such as moving around and picking and dropping items. A Kiva object's attributes include it's current location on a map, current direction it's facing, the map layout that it's moving on, status of whether it's carrying a pod, if it has successfully dropped a pod and a motor life time that indicates how much of it's motor life has been spent.
    Version:
    4/25/2021
    Author:
    Natan Alper
    See Also:
    KivaCommand

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Kiva(FloorMap map)
      Creates a Kiva robot instance using only a FloorMap.
      Kiva(FloorMap map, edu.duke.Point currentLocation)
      Creates a Kiva robot instance using a FloorMap and a Point to set the starting location of the Kiva robot.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void drop()
      Kiva object will drop pod.
      protected edu.duke.Point getCurrentLocation()
      Returns the current location of the Kiva object.
      protected FacingDirection getDirectionFacing()
      Returns the direction that the Kiva object is facing on the map (UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT).
      protected FloorMap getMap()
      Returns the map which the Kiva is using to navigate.
      long getMotorLifetime()
      Returns the motorLifetime utilized by the Kiva, measured in milliseconds.
      void incrementMotorLifetime()
      Adds 1000 milliseconds to the motorLifetime (indicating that another 1000 milliseconds have been used).
      boolean isCarryingPod()
      Returns true if Kiva is carrying the pod and false if not.
      boolean isSuccessfullyDropped()
      Returns true if Kiva successfully dropped the pod and false if not.
      void move(KivaCommand command)
      Depending on the KivaCommand it receives, move() will update the current location, the direction the robot is pointing, whether it is carrying a pod or if the pod has been successfully dropped.
      void take()
      Kiva object will take/pick up pod.
      void turnLeft()
      Kiva object's direction will rotate to the left.
      void turnRight()
      Kiva object's direction will rotate to the right.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Kiva

        public Kiva(FloorMap map)
        Creates a Kiva robot instance using only a FloorMap.
        Parameters:
        map - FloorMap of the area. Includes the starting location of the Kiva robot, location of the boundaries, obstacles, pod and drop-zone.

      • Kiva

        public Kiva(FloorMap map,
            edu.duke.Point currentLocation)
        Creates a Kiva robot instance using a FloorMap and a Point to set the starting location of the Kiva robot.
        Parameters:
        map - FloorMap of the area. Includes the locations of the Kiva robot, boudaries, obstacles, pod and drop-zone.
        currentLocation - Starting location of the Kiva robot.

    • Method Detail

      • drop

        public void drop()
        Kiva object will drop pod. This will throw a IllegalMoveException if it is not holding a pod at the time of the drop or, an IllegalDropZoneException if it is not at a drop-zone location.

      • getCurrentLocation

        protected edu.duke.Point getCurrentLocation()
        Returns the current location of the Kiva object.
        Returns:
        the current location as a Point (x-y coordinate).

      • getDirectionFacing

        protected FacingDirection getDirectionFacing()
        Returns the direction that the Kiva object is facing on the map (UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT).
        Returns:
        current direction that the Kiva is facing as a FacingDirection object

      • getMap

        protected FloorMap getMap()
        Returns the map which the Kiva is using to navigate.
        Returns:
        map that shows the starting locations of the Kiva, obstacles, boundaries, pod, and drop-zone, as a FloorMap object.

      • getMotorLifetime

        public long getMotorLifetime()
        Returns the motorLifetime utilized by the Kiva, measured in milliseconds.

      • incrementMotorLifetime

        public void incrementMotorLifetime()
        Adds 1000 milliseconds to the motorLifetime (indicating that another 1000 milliseconds have been used).

      • isCarryingPod

        public boolean isCarryingPod()
        Returns true if Kiva is carrying the pod and false if not.

      • isSuccessfullyDropped

        public boolean isSuccessfullyDropped()
        Returns true if Kiva successfully dropped the pod and false if not.

      • move

        public void move(KivaCommand command)
        Depending on the KivaCommand it receives, move() will update the current location, the direction the robot is pointing, whether it is carrying a pod or if the pod has been successfully dropped.
        Parameters:
        command - KivaCommand that indicates the specific movement the Kiva robot should perform.
        See Also:
        turnLeft(), turnRight(), take(), drop()

      • take

        public void take()
        Kiva object will take/pick up pod. This will throw a NoPodException if it is already holding a pod or, if there is no pod at the current location.

      • turnLeft

        public void turnLeft()
        Kiva object's direction will rotate to the left. Does NOT change the location that the Kiva object is currently at.

      • turnRight

        public void turnRight()
        Kiva object's direction will rotate to the right. Does NOT change the location that the Kiva object is currently at.
